questions.question: Present Perfect - Structure
questions.answer: Subject + have/has + past participle. Example: I have studied English for 5 years. Used for actions that started in the past and continue to the present, or have present relevance.

questions.question: Difference between 'make' and 'do'
questions.answer: MAKE: Used for creating/producing something (make a cake, make a decision, make money). DO: Used for actions/activities (do homework, do exercise, do the dishes).

questions.question: Past Simple vs Past Continuous
questions.answer: Past Simple: Completed action (I walked). Past Continuous: Action in progress in the past (I was walking). Often used together: I was walking when it started to rain.
